1. In a clean, dry mixing container, weigh out 180 g of Oxygen (O). 2. Add 60 g of Phosphorus (P) to the container. 3. Incorporate 10 g of Scandium (Sc) into the mixture. 4. Finally, add 10 g of Vanadium (V). 5. Mix the ingredients thoroughly using a stirrer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a clean, dry mixing container, weigh out 180 g of Oxygen (O). 2. Add 60 g of Phosphorus (P) to the container. 3. Incorporate 10 g of Scandium (Sc) into the mixture. 4. Finally, add 10 g of Vanadium (V). 5. Mix the ingredients thoroughly using a stirrer until a homogeneous mixture is achieved.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the container. 2. Use fine-grit sandpaper (220 grit) to smooth the surface and edges of the solid sample. 3. Seal the sample with a suitable epoxy resin for durability, allowing it to cure for 24 hours at room temperature.
